{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3528079,"name":"Jiovanni Zinedine Sookhai","username":"jio","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/fbc32d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-15T18:27:48.161Z","cooked":"

Hello, I’m currently programming a swerve drive. It’s generated entirely from Phoenix X, and it works great for following simple Pathplanner paths and field-oriented drive. A new goal I’ve decided to pursue is reef alignment.

The general idea is to run three PID controllers for x, y, and theta control to drive the robot’s current pose to a goal pose. So far, after testing on AdvantageScope Sim and on the robot, it can drive well to a preset Pose2d that I set up in the code. After successful testing, I’ve decided to integrate the Limelight into the mix to align with the reef, or more specifically, with a particular AprilTag. However, I’m stuck on how to generate the goal pose.

For testing purposes, I simply want to align with an AprilTag 1 meter away from the robot, directly in front of the tag. After that, I want to align with the reef. The trouble is how to generate the goal pose, where the robot will drive 1 meter away and directly in front of the goal pose. My first thought was to use the getTargetPose_CameraSpace method from the Limelight helpers class, convert that to a Pose2d (its a Pose3d) and then use the Pose.toRelative method to convert the robot’s target coordinates from camera-relative to field-relative coordinates, where the robot actually is on the field. After that, I would apply a Transform2d to the relative pose, which would move the robot back by -1 meter from the current relative pose. My issue is that I don’t fully understand how all of the Pose-specific methods work, and I’m unclear about how the Limelight coordinate system compares to that of WPILib.

The ultimate goal is to create left and right pose transforms for each reef scoring area, based on an AprilTag in it. However, for now, I just want to back the robot 1 meter away from an AprilTag.

In summary, how would I generate a goal pose 1 meter away from the Limelight, based on the current robot pose? My concern is that I’m inexperienced with modifying poses, and I don’t want to dive in without some clarification on how to do this. As a final mention, I was particularly inspired by FRC 6328’s footage of their 2023 robot backing up to a particular pose for a moving AprilTag, and I want to replicate something similar.

Why not just localize off of the tag and use your PID to drive the robot to a position on the field?

First of all, sorry if misuse any terminology, I’m still inexperienced with anything involving pose modification, and localization. But are you saying treat the tag as if its were the reference point, or origin, then generate a goal pose from that?

Create Translation2ds for left, center and right reef positions including your 1 meter offset. Then create a Transform2d from the current one and your robot target offset pose is tagPose.transformBy(transform)

I assume you’re using a SwerveDrivePoseEstimator. If you’re not then go with what the other guy said. I was saying just call .addVisionMeasurement on that with your estimated robot pose (since you’re using a Limelight, I’m pretty sure that pose would be acquired from the getBotPose2d_wpiBlue method in LimelightLib). Then just store a list of all scoring Pose2ds in field coordinates and use your PID to drive to the nearest one.

Also, if it helps, limelight has an article on this stuff in their docs.

docs.limelightvision.io

Robot Localization with MegaTag2 | Limelight Documentation

Introduced in 2024, Megatag2 is a precise and ambiguity-free AprilTag-based localizer for mobile robots. It was built with the following goals:

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-02-15T18:52:32.464Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":73,"readers_count":72,"score":34.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":491837,"topic_slug":"creating-a-suitable-goal-pose-to-align-to","display_username":"Adam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.limelightvision.io/docs/docs-limelight/pipeline-apriltag/apriltag-robot-localization-megatag2","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Robot Localization with MegaTag2 | Limelight Documentation","clicks":9}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":53665,"username":"jio","name":"Jiovanni Zinedine Sookhai","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/fbc32d/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56055,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/creating-a-suitable-goal-pose-to-align-to/491837/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3528113,"name":"Jiovanni Zinedine Sookhai","username":"jio","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/fbc32d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-15T19:00:54.424Z","cooked":"

I was initially considering have preset list of Pose2d’s, and finding one based on which particular apriltag we were looking at, or the one we are scoring at the moment. However the issue I have is that our field isn’t fully constructed, it won’t have a mirrored side due to a lack of space. Further, the placement of the apriltags haven’t been started yet (we are printing a set at the moment, I printed 2 just for testing purposes several weeks ago, their id’s are 9 and 10). So I figured a more dynamic approach of generating the goal poses, based on the closest tag we were looking at was the most ideal approach for the constraints we have. By those constraints I have the apriltags propt up in some arbitary open space location on our field, they aren’t accurately placed yet relative to the entire field. So I was only considering how to generate goal poses based on where an apriltag was relative to the camera.

On another note, I have the add vision measurement of mega tag 2 in the periodic method of the drive subsystem, so it currently does some pose estimation.

Oh okay, then what @icemannie said should work. If you want to keep everything relative to one tag just transform the tag pose relative to your camera by some offset.

Although if you’re doing this, make sure you can still see the tag clearly when you’re flush with the reef and it isn’t at some crazy angle, as that might throw you off a bit.
